64.heading: Bonnix, Burl.
64.title: The Comic Book Kids [videorecording]
64.author: producer, Sandra Turbow, Herb Silvers ; director, Gene Weed ; writer, Jim Engelhardt ; starring Joseph Campanella.
notes: CinemaKid Productions, 1986.
1 videocassette (ca. 60 min.) : s.d., col. ; 1/2 in.
VHS format.

Summary: "Burl Bonnix (Joseph Campanella) is the boss of Bonnix Comics. Marvin is his frustrated cartoonist and Carry and Skeets are two bright kids who have befriended Fantos, the comic book wizard. Fantos has given them magic belts with transporter rings. With a pull of the rings (pow) the kids are instantly in the comic strip scenes created by Marvin. Each episode is adventure packed and music filled. Comic books come to life with the Comic Book Kids."

90.heading: Bons Baisers de New York--Articles About.
90.title: "De Toutes les Couleurs : Spiegelman au New Yorker"
90.author: Harry Morgan
90.appears_in: p. 44-46 in 9e Art : les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 10 (Apr. 2004).
notes: Begins: "Dans Bon Baisers de New York (éd. Flammarion, 2003), bel album superbement imprimé sur un papier qui rend justice au contenu, Art Spiegelman commente ses couvertures et accessoriement ses croquis et ses BD pour le New Yorker, l'hebdomadaire américain des milieux cultivés, célèbre depuis les années vingt pour ses dessins humoristiques. L'abonné du magazine feuillettera cette collection de couvertures avec nostalgie (l'achat du livre lui économisant naturellement une expédition à la cave pour consulter la collection du journal) et se livrera au petit jeu du souvenir: les couvertures de Spiegelman qu'il avait gardées en tête, celles que leur consultation lui remet en mémoire, celles qu'il a l'impression de voir pour la première fois."

English summary (from p. 126): "Full Colour: Spiegelman at the New Yorker. By reuniting all the short strips and especially the numerous covers that he has given the prestigious New Yorker from 1993 on, Bons Baisers de New York (Flammarion) reveals another facet of Spiegelman's work. Harry Morgan praises the pertinence of these editorial drawings."
Includes illustrations.

161.title: Bonne Année
notes: Bonne Année / Baru. -- Tournai : Casterman, 1998. -- 72 p. : ill. ; 30 cm. -- Call no.: PN6747.B34B6 1998

Summary: An incident on New Year's Eve 2000 has led to a civil war in France, and to the fortification of the city centers. By New Year's Eve 2014, a dictator has come to power, and things are tough for the have-nots outside the walls. The guards shoot to kill, AIDS is rampant, and there are no condoms to be had. Mo' and Sonia meet near the wall, where she thinks she has a way in. Her friend Jimmy is no longer there, however, and the new guards turn her away. They pretend to let Mo' in, but it's only a trick to steal his jacket. For consolation, Sonia shows him a handful of condoms she's gotten on other trips, and they run away hand in hand. At the bowling alley, Maggy gets tired of waiting for Mo', and leaves with the rest of the girls. Julien and Hocine decide to make a trip under the wall to buy condoms, using an old drug dealers' tunnel. Hocine's information is old, and the tunnel emerges in a house that is no longer empty. What's more, condoms can only be bought from machines using cards. The pharmacist wonders why they're not vaccinated, then takes all their money for one condom. The police haul them in, then kick them out of the city because it's New Year's Eve.

Review: "Bonne Année, Baru" p. 67 in Bachi-Bouzouk , no. 1 (fév. 1999). -- (Lecture Obligatoire : Les Meilleures BD 1998 à Lire les Yeux Fermés) -- Brief review/recommendation. -- Call no.: PN6745.B3no.1
